review: Easy to install since it comes pre-loaded with your Amazon account info, and Prime if you have it. I also have a Roku, which I moved to another room and put the Fire in the living room. The picture quality is excellent and the remote is fairly easy to operate, although the circle directional button frequently jumps ahead to more than one selection. Annoying, but not fatal. Selecting the apps is not as easy as the Roku since the most frequently used ones are jumbled in with lots of others that I'm not interested in. I suspect this is a marketing decision to get people to see the game apps. Annoying. The remote is more comfortable to hold than the Roku remote and the back button is very useful. I got the box version rather than the stick so I would have the option of plugging in a USB stick. My Roku also has this feature. I will give it some time to see if it proves to be better and firmware updates fix some of the things I don't like.
